options: A program is a set of precise instructions written in a programming language that tell a computer how to perform a specific task
A program is a piece of hardware, like a graphics card or a processor, that physically makes a computer work
A program is a general idea or a plan for solving a problem, but it doesn't need to be written down for a computer to understand
Programming is the act of typing very fast to hack into computer systems, often depicted in movies with green text on a black screen
Programming is the skill of using existing computer programs, like a web browser or a word processor, to complete specific tasks
Programming is the process of creating computer programs by writing code in special programming languages

questionText: Which of the following areas heavily rely on C programming? (Select all that apply)
